subject: Physical Fitness
title: Protein and Muscle Repair
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Protein and Muscle Repair.

hook.text: After a workout, your muscles are damaged. Protein provides the raw materials to rebuild them bigger.

buildup.text: Dietary protein breaks into amino acids. Twenty types exist; nine are essential â€” your body can't make them.

discovery.text: Leucine is the key amino acid. It directly activates the mTOR pathway that starts muscle building.

twist.text: Eating more protein doesn't mean more muscle. Beyond 1.6 g per kg of bodyweight, extra has little benefit.

climax.text: Timing matters less than total intake. Spreading protein across meals optimizes synthesis all day.

punchline.text: Protein rebuilds muscle. But more isn't always better â€” enough is.

quiz.question: Which amino acid directly activates the muscle-building mTOR pathway?
